For some reason, students feel entitled to a grade despite not putting in any effort. Then, they blame the instructor when they can't keep their GPA up. I know that Vincent is always willing to do whatever it takes to help his students succeed. He has a great rapport with his students and always has a beautiful smile. Thanks, Vincent!?

Vincent is adorable! He is a very dedicated instructor, is always well prepared, and he is very helpful. The comment that suggested he was a terrible professor is from someone who withdrew, so didn't attend most of the class, and isn't a reliable source. I felt lucky to hear French from a native speaker. If you do your work, you will benefit!

Vincent is an extremely kind, intelligent, and caring person who is always willing to help. It is clear that he goes the extra mile for his students. He is also very handsome! The course material is difficult if you don't study, but anyone who makes an effort will succeed with Vincent. He is by far the best professor I have ever had at OSU.

Vincent Bernard means well. However, he was an incredibly hard teacher. He is a tough grader, fast speaker, and his lack of experience is very apparent. I don't recommend him unless you are very advanced in French. Personally, I thought he was the worst teacher I have had at OSU.

Very helpful teacher. Workbook, which is relatively easy but time consuming, was only homework due every 3 classes or so. Exams and tests are manageable, especially with the reviews she does beforehand. Speaks only French in class unless it's something extremely important that we HAVE to understand. Overall a well above average teacher.
Mme Wise is a very energetic teacher but sometimes she can be very strict and intimidating.
Anais is adorable and energetic. She's a native speaker and super helpful

I loved this Modern French class. Mme Wise was an exceptional teacher and she was so nice when grading and making quizzes. I did like the fact that she was a native speaker and cold tell us things that wouldn't otherwise be taught. This was definitely one of my favorite classes thus far.
she's so cool and makes the

One of the best teachers I have ever had! She is energetic, clear, and a native speaker, so she has a better (I feel) grasp of the nuances and exceptions. Always helpful and mindful of a student's ability, but also pushes you to improve yourself at the same time. I enjoyed French coming in, and I still enjoy it coming out!
Best French teacher I have every had. I would def. recommend it.. if you study you will come out with an A and a better understanding of the French Language!
Native french speaker, energetic, helpful, you will lean alot in her class. By far the best of the 4 french teachers I have had. I would definately recommend her!
No Comments

Melanie is very helpful if you don't understand stuff.  Learning a language is hard in general, but she tries really hard to make it easy for you.  Going to class is mandatory and you get points for class participation, quizzes and homework due every week, but they are not hard at all.  She makes quizzes easy points.

Melanie is excellent. I just finished 104 with her and she couldnt have been any nicer or more helpful. Like others have said, she is very impartial and is calm. She expects a lot, but one can expect a lot in return if they try and participate

Melanie is super nice! Very fair which is annoying for weekly participation points, but thats how it goes! Exams are real fair, make sure you know your culture stuff because its like 25% of the test. Compositions nor the oral test were bad- very fair on everything and always helpful! :)
Great teacher! very easy to understand and very helpful.
No Comments
She's a great teacher. Her french is beautiful. It was one of the first classes I took at OSU, so I was intimidated by the only speaking French in class, but it really helps you learn! Easy A!
great teacher and not bad to look at either
J'aimais Lisa. She communicates in clear French and teaches well. The tests are fair and she is very approachable. Definitely  take her.

Lisa was great! She is so adorable and trys extremely hard. She speaks beautiful French, which is nice to listen to but is sometimes hard to comprehend if you don't speak French well. If you go to class, participate, and read the required play, you will do just fine!! Just make sure to use your accent marks :)
No Comments
She is a good teacher. Very helpful!

Lisa is very helpful. She is a grad. student so she understands that we have a heavy workload because hers is probably heavier. Be aware though that if you haven't taken French in a while, everything is spoken in French most of the time.
Great professor.  Really got me interested in French studies.  So much so that I have now changed my major to French.  Take her class if you have the chance!
This professor was very friendly.  She is younger and was able to have fun while teaching the material.
You cannot understand a word she says or writes and is an extremely harsh grader.

He comes across as bored, angry, arrogant and supercilious. He makes little attempt to explain material and when he does ask if his explanation is clear, his demeanor is so offputting no one asks for further clarification. The worst language instructor I've ever had. What a waste.

Every class period you are expected to have read material from the text, completed homework, and be prepared to take a quiz on the material. The quizzes are easy and he just checks for completion on hw, but you have to do hw and show up to his class. Like any foreign language class, you have to participate. Overall I learned alot and enjoyed it.

difficult material, but he gives a pretty good explanation of it. very knowledgeable and enjoys what he's teaching about, making it interesting for students, even if it's hard to comprehend. class is very speaking oriented. material is interesting. professor is nice, helpful. i'd take this class again.
Oh Lasseigne. He is super nice, his clothing is adorably ridiculous, and he has the worst french accent I have ever heard. But he is a nice guy.
Good professor, nice and considerate, really takes the time to make sure students understand the lesson. always had extra review sessions.
Nice guy and dedicated to making sure his students know the material. is very open to extra review sessions. however, class is very boring and he is often disorganized.
WORST ACCENT I HAVE EVER EVER HEARD. DOESN'T EVEN PRONOUNCE LIASONS; TERRIBLE. IF YOU ARE A FRANCOPHONE, YOU WILL BE APPALLED.
He was a very good teacher and very leinent!  I recommend him as a professor!
No Comments

He is the best French teacher in the department. He is very knowledgeable and is devoted to helping his students out. He prepares his students well for the midterms and the final. He's also a lenient grader sometimes too.
He is sometimes hard to understang and tends to confuse students but he is an easy grader and is a decent guy.

Bruce is a great guy with some hilarious stories... definitely makes coming in for an 8:30 class worth your time and zzzz's. Absolutely terrible in returning assignments and you never have any idea what your grade is... but the class is so easy that it doesn't make a difference anyway. Take him... and ask him about his Kenny Chesney concert. Do it.

He is very late at returning assignments and you never find out what your grade is. Although if you read the chapter the night before his power points are basically a refresher. Also he expects you to know all the material before you see it in class because the quizzes are at the beginning of class. Mostly English speaking.
He does take his time returning assignments because he is a 'laid back' teacher. But he's also 'laid back' about everything else too, like turning assignments in on time. He's a cool teacher.
Late in returning homework, quizzes and exams. Don't expect to know what your grade is.
